alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 334 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion Station, or 7 miles southwest of Pocomoke City. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, West Pocomoke, Rehobeth, Shelltown and Beaver Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
